description: The Japanese painted fern (Athyrium 'Branford Rambler') is an amazing plant species. Its cascading fronds emerge from crowns of vivid maroon and are deeply cut, resembling tiny butterflies. The silvery-gray fronds also have touches of purple and pink, depending on how much sunlight it receives. This fern does best in shade or part shade conditions, and its glossy foliage will add texture and a pop of color to any garden or living space. Its ability to tolerate drought and humidity makes it a great choice for anyone, and it can also be used in containers and as an understory plant. Its unique color, texture, and form make the Japanese painted fern a remarkable addition to any outdoor space.
